title: About
text:
As an applied scientist for Amazon in the field of surface transportation, I am part of a dedicated team that specializes in the development of mathematical models for scheduling truck operations. Our objective is to optimize the utilization of transportation resources to ensure the timely and efficient delivery of goods. Our models are implemented in practice to make data-driven decisions that save money for the company.
Before working for Amazon I worked on model checking and reactive synthesis for a variety of models, including state-transition graphs, Markov Decision Processes (MDPs), and game graphs. My work focused on verifying and constructing correct reactive systems using a range of ω-regular objectives, including reachability, Büchi, bounded Büchi, Streett, and parity objectives. I also utilized fast graph algorithms and modern algorithmic techniques to improve the efficiency of my work. During my research, I published 7 papers in top computer science conferences and received a grade of “with distinction” for my PhD dissertation, which was nominated for the Award of Excellence from the Austrian government and the GI dissertation prize. My full publication record can be found at https://dblp.org/pid/202/2327.html.

Please note that the opinions expressed in this blog post are my own and do not reflect the views of Amazon. I am an independent individual with my own thoughts and ideas, and my views do not represent those of my employer or any other organization.

title: Weightloss Myths
text:
In today’s fast-paced world, everyone is looking for a quick fix to their weight problems. The weight loss market in the U.S. is valued at $72.6 billion1, and as a result, it’s no surprise that many scammers infiltrated this space in an attempt to make a quick buck off of other people’s misery.
Undoubtedly, losing weight is a complicated endeavor and many people struggle with it, especially in light of the recent pandemic. It can be hard to separate the truth from the lies and the genuine products from the frauds. In this blog post, I’ll be sharing my personal experiences and providing a mechanism to filter out the frauds immediately.
Please note that the information in this post is based on my personal interest and experience in the topic and should be taken at your own risk. I’ve researched nutrition for building muscle to get stronger and then later on to lose fat to run faster for more than 10 years, and I want to share what I’ve learned along the way.

title: Do not fall for this weightloss myth
text:
Food is transformed to energy
No matter what you eat, the body is a complex mechanism transforming everything we eat into energy (kcal). If you eat something at time \(t\), \(c^t_{in}\), will be positive. For example, If you eat an apple (~80kcal) at 1pm then \(c^{13}_{in} = 80\).
How much you eat over time is the single most important factor when considering weightloss for our human robot. In the following picture we see the energy intake for (1) a human eating three meals and (2) a human fasting until the end of the day. They both do exercise at 4pm and end up in at the same energy balance at the end of the day maintaining their weight. There is no evidence that fasting brought any advantage in terms of energy balance.


Code
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
df = pd.DataFrame(
    
    {
    '3_meals' : [0] * 7 + [700] + 5*[0] + [1000] + [0] * 5 + [1000] + 4*[0],
     'fasting' : [0] * 19 + [2700] + [0] * 4,
     'c_out' : [70] * 15  + [1050] + [75] * 8,
    }
).assign(**{
    '3_meals_cum' : lambda x: x['3_meals'].cumsum(),
    'fasting_cum' : lambda x: x['fasting'].cumsum(),
    'energy_expended (day level)': lambda x: x['c_out'].cumsum()
})

fig, ax = plt.subplots()
sns.lineplot(data=df[['3_meals_cum', 'fasting_cum',
             'energy_expended (day level)']], ax=ax)
xticks = list(range(0, len(df)))

ax.set_ylabel("KCal")
ax.set_xticks(xticks)
ax.set_xticklabels(xticks, rotation=90)
ax.set_xlabel("Hours")
plt.show()

Any diet, food claim with the aim of losing weight which does create a negative energy balance is a fraud and should be rejected without further consideration.
Losing weight is not easy in real life circumstances: After doing the obvious things to consume less calories like changing soda to diet soda/drinking water and eating healthy to eat less there is only one option left: diet.
